Vancouver Trees Dashboard (2025)
A side project, just for fun! 
This web app lets you explore all public trees in Vancouver, BC. Includes an interactive map, Google Street View integration, a table for exploring species, and a heatmap for exploring tree height by neighbourhood.

Automated Medical Image Segmentation for Precision Orthopedic Surgery (2025)
Capstone project for my Master of Data Science at the University of British Columbia in Vancouver, BC.
This project was a collaboration with the Digital Lab at the BC Children‚Äôs Hospital. Our team developed a dashboard and end-to-end machine learning pipeline to automatically segment bones from CT scan imagery and export these models for 3D printing. This end-to-end pipeline will allow clinical engineers and orthopedic surgeons to more quickly and accurately plan procedures, increasing caseload capacity and reducing patient wait times.
Technologies used:

nnU-Net neural network architecture
Plotly Dash
Python
Docker



Patient Validation of a Motor Imagery-based Neurofeedback Paradigm (2017)
Undergraduate Honours Project for my B.Sc. in Neuroscience at Dalhousie University in Halifax, NS.
Designed and implemented digital signal processing and analysis pipelines for high-resolution MEG data to evaluate a motor imagery‚Äìbased neurofeedback paradigm in stroke patients. Developed preprocessing, artifact rejection, and source localization workflows in Python to detect and quantify beta-band activity in sensorimotor cortex, producing visualizations and laterality metrics to compare patient and control data.
Technologies used:

Python
NumPy
SciPy
Matplotlib



Android App for EEG-based Neurofeedback in Stroke Recovery (2015)
Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowship (RADIANT Program), IWK Health Centre, Halifax, NS.
Collected and analyzed electroencephalography (EEG) data for a project investigating neurofeedback in motor imagery therapy, supporting the development of a brain-computer interface for stroke recovery.
Developed and tested a mobile application that implemented the project‚Äôs digital signal processing algorithms for live EEG data, providing a mobile platform for neurofeedback-assisted motor imagery therapy.
